728170f-c.text:
Vernon Boulevard, north from and across 43rd Road. At the N.E. corner of 43rd Road is an old peak-roofed house, also shown in view 2. In the background is the Queensborough Bridge; just this side of the bridge are the Calman Varnish Works. At the S.E. corner of 43rd Road formerly (1891) stood the Ravenswood glass works. View 3 shows the old house, seen looking westward along the north side of 43rd Road from 9th Street.

View 1: Eugene L. Armbruster Collection   1925

Views 2,3: F.L. Sperr

View 2: July 26, 1939
View 3: June 24, 1932

728171f-a.text:
Vernon Boulevard, west side, at 43rd Road, showing the Bodine Castle, modeled after a French castle. It was erected by J. Bodine, a French nobleman who was exiled from his native land. An underground tunnel can be seen leading into the house from the East River waterfront. Bodine's name first appears on Beers's 1873 map of Long Island City.

P.L. Sperr   June 24, 1932  Views 1,2

P.L. Sperr   June 24, 1932  Views 1,2

728172f-a.text:
Long Island City
Bodine Castle

C. Manley DeBevoise
51-05 Browvale Lane
Little Neck, New York 11362

Neg. #27

728173f-c.text:
Vernon Boulevard, west side, at 43rd Road, showing the Bodine Castle, erected by J. Bodine, an exiled French nobleman. It is the last of the old mansions which adorned the East River front in this area.

Arthur White

1920's (?)
Views 1,2,3
